title: Service-Learning Instructional Design for Supporting Individuals with Dementia

context.prior_knowledge: Basic gerontological education and social science theory comprehension, experience in educational program planning
context.additional_context: A practical educational program linked with community dementia service centers for graduate students majoring in social education

learning_goals: Learners will design three educational activities reflecting cognitive/emotional characteristics of dementia patients (e.g., reminiscence therapy, emotional expression art, simple rule-based physical activities), implement two in field practice, and achieve an average satisfaction score of 4.0 or higher (5-point scale) from participants.
Enhancing the ability to develop dementia family support strategies through Problem-Based Learning (PBL)

Over two weeks, learners will write reflective journals twice weekly, incorporate at least three peer feedbacks, and submit a 1,000-character reflective report systematically analyzing service/customer interaction experiences.

resources: Community Dementia Service Center Collaboration Network
Educational Resource Package for Elderly with Dementia

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
